newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea mth-mth foreign exchange holdings rise.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea mth-mth foreign exchange holdings rise.

text.p: South Korea's foreign exchange holdings rose to $32.32 billion in November from $32.23 billion in October but fell from $33.22 billion a year earlier, the Bank of Korea said.
An official of the central bank said it was the first monthly rise for five months in the country's foreign exchange holdings.
"The reserves had fallen because of current account deficits but in November we had a relatively large capital account surplus," he said.
The bank has said it expects the country's current account deficit for all of this year to reach $22 billion against $8.95 billion in 1995.
